review.title: “G by guess”
review.pros: Pros – Great customers, can have fun with them and build relationships. Concept and design are fun and unique.
review.cons: Cons – None that I can think of.

review.title: “I love it here!”
review.pros: Pros – 40% employee discount.Great managers and co-workers.Pretty cute clothes,purses,shoes,sandals etc.Every once in a while employees get 50% discount in all the regular clothes.I love working here all the time nice environment!Nice club music and loud (costumers hardly hear us when we greet them.LOL!)We have walkie -talkie to communicate.Which is so cool!The SALES section is already 50% but you get additional 50% off.Really cheap!
review.cons: Cons – -Associates schedule is base on how much we sell in a day,weeks and in a month.-Associates are very competitive and steal your costumer even though they've seen you that you are helping that person.They don't even care or bother to ask who help her/him first,but because they just want the sell for themselves.-A lot of costumers don't even need our help because they got it or they are just browsing around..Sometimes they just leave because it kinda annoys them that we follow them all the time and ask them the "Are you finding everything okay!" Again and again!-At the cash register.The cashier will ask the costumer,"Did anybody helped you today?" and if she said, she did/he did then the sale goes to your sell credit.(we have to tell them our name so that they will know who helped costumers).Overall if you want to work here and get hired just provide great costumer service and have fun with it.=)
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Lukewarm”
review.pros: Pros – The great thing about working there was the discount. You can use it at G, Guess, Marciano, Guess Kids, and Factory. Flexible hours. You can listen to music all day and meet great people. The best thing is the employee bonus days: 50% off anything. Includes red marked down items.
review.cons: Cons – You don't get paid anything at all. Just minimum wage. No matter how long you've been with the company..... you may even see a 10 cent raise during your time there. There's really no room for moving up the career ladder if you live in a city other than the headquarters. Requires you to work hours on holidays...You have to meet daily and weekly sales goals so it can get mighty competitive and ugly on the sales floor. This is how you get your hours. By the way you don't even get commission. They require you to wear G By Guess clothes to work and dont really like it if you wear the other brands. The G clothes are very poor quality, expensive and ill-fitting. If you are a high schooler the clothes may be suited for you, but not young adults. Very tacky and bedazzled. Managers show favoritism to employees that sell the most. Overall, its a headache. High turnover.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat the employees with more respect. After all they are the driving force to bring in the all the money to keep your job and meet all the monthly, quarterly and yearly goals. They do a lot of work to not even be paid that much.
